get in.translation[0].definitions[0].def: to enter a place, especially when this is difficult
get in.translation[0].definitions[0].exa: We managed to get in through a window.
The theatre was already full, and we couldn’t get in.
get in.translation[0].definitions[1].def: if a train, plane etc gets in at a particular time, it arrives at that time
get in.translation[0].definitions[1].exa: What time does the bus get in?
We get in to Heathrow at ten o’clock.
get in.translation[0].definitions[2].exa: We didn’t get in until late.
What time do the boys get in from school?
get in.translation[0].definitions[3].def: to be elected to a position of political power
get in.translation[0].definitions[3].exa: The Conservatives have promised to increase spending on health and education if they get in.
get in.translation[0].definitions[4].def: to be allowed to be a student at a university, college etc
get in.translation[0].definitions[4].exa: I applied to Bristol University, but I didn’t get in.
get in.translation[0].definitions[5].def: to buy a supply of something
get in.translation[0].definitions[5].exa: I must remember to get some food in for the weekend.
get in.translation[0].definitions[6].def: to gather a crop and bring it to a sheltered place
get in.translation[0].definitions[6].exa: The whole village was involved with getting the harvest in.
get in.translation[0].definitions[7].def: to ask someone to come to your home to do a job, especially to repair something
get in.translation[0].definitions[7].exa: We’ll have to get a plumber in.
get in.translation[0].definitions[8].def: to send something to a particular place or give it to a particular person
get in.translation[0].definitions[8].exa: Please can you get your essays in by Thursday.
It’s best to get your insurance claim in as quickly as possible.
get in.translation[0].definitions[9].def: to manage to do something even though you do not have much time
get in.translation[0].definitions[9].exa: We’re hoping to get in a game of golf over the weekend.
